title: Bra–ket notation
summary: In quantum mechanics, bra–ket notation, or Dirac notation, is used ubiquitously to denote quantum states. The notation uses angle brackets, ⟨ {\displaystyle \langle } and ⟩ {\displaystyle \rangle } , and a vertical bar | {\displaystyle |} , to construct "bras" and "kets".
